sen.j: 衣笠（きぬがさ）とは
sen.e: Kinugasa:
Kinugasa:
Kinugasa is:

sen.j: 京都府京都市北区 (京都市)・右京区にある地名。
sen.e: The place-name of an area belonging to Kita Ward (Kyoto City) and Ukyo Ward of Kyoto City Kyoto Prefecture.
The place-name of an area belonging to Kita Ward (Kyoto City) and Ukyo Ward of Kyoto City Kyoto Prefecture.
a place-name of an area belonging to Kita Ward (Kyoto City) and Ukyo Ward of Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: このページで説明する。
sen.e: This page outlines this area.
This page outlines this area.
A detailed description is provided on this page.

sen.j: 神奈川県横須賀市にある地名（古城衣笠城の跡がある）。
sen.e: The place-name of an area belonging to Yokosuka City Kanagawa Prefecture (the site of Kinugasa-jo Castle)
The place-name of an area belonging to Yokosuka City Kanagawa Prefecture (the site of Kinugasa-jo Castle)
a place-name of an area belonging to Yokosuka City, Kanagawa Prefecture (the site of Kinugasa-jo Castle).

sen.j: 大日本帝国海軍の重巡洋艦。
sen.e: A heavy cruiser of former Japanese Imperial Navy
A heavy cruiser by the former Japanese Imperial Navy
a heavy cruiser by the former Japanese Imperial Navy.

sen.j: 詳しくは衣笠 (重巡洋艦)を参照。
sen.e: See the Kinugasa (heavy cruiser) section for more details.
See the Kinugasa (heavy cruiser) section for more details.
See the Kinugasa (heavy cruiser) section for more details.

sen.j: 名字の一つ。
sen.e: A family name
A family name
a family name.

sen.j: 衣笠貞之助、衣笠祥雄など。
sen.e: For example, Teinosuke KINUGASA and Sachio KINUGASA
For example, Teinosuke KINUGASA and Sachio KINUGASA
For example, Teinosuke KINUGASA and Sachio KINUGASA

sen.j: 世界＞アジア＞日本＞京都府＞京都市＞北区 (京都市)＞衣笠
sen.e: World＞Asia＞Japan＞Kyoto Prefecture＞Kyoto city＞Kita Ward (Kyoto city)＞Kinugasa
World＞Asia＞Japan＞Kyoto Prefecture＞Kyoto city＞Kita Ward (Kyoto city)＞Kinugasa
World＞Asia＞Japan＞Kyoto Prefecture＞Kyoto City＞Kita Ward (Kyoto City)＞Kinugasa

sen.j: 衣笠（きぬがさ）とは、京都府京都市北区 (京都市)・右京区の地名。
sen.e: Kinugasa is the place-name of an area belonging to Kita Ward (Kyoto City) and Ukyo Ward of Kyoto City Kyoto Prefecture..
Kinugasa is the place-name of an area belonging to Kita Ward (Kyoto City) and Ukyo Ward of Kyoto City Kyoto Prefecture..
Kinugasa is the place-name of an area belonging to Kita Ward (Kyoto City) and Ukyo Ward of Kyoto City Kyoto Prefecture..

sen.j: 地域としては等持院や龍安寺付近を含むが、住所表記はそれより狭義である。
sen.e: The area includes Tojiin Temple and Ryoan-ji Temple and their vicinity, but Kinugasa as an address covers a smaller area.
The area includes Tojiin Temple and Ryoan-ji Temple and their vicinity, but Kinugasa as an address covers a smaller area.
The area includes Toji-in Temple and Ryoan-ji Temple and their vicinity, but Kinugasa as an address covers a smaller area.

sen.j: なお、葛野郡衣笠村は1918年に京都市に編入されている。
sen.e: For reference, Kinugasa-mura Kadono District was merged into Kyoto City in 1918.
For reference, Kinugasa-mura Kadono District was merged into Kyoto City in 1918.
For reference, Kinugasa-mura, Kadono District was merged into Kyoto City in 1918.
sen.cmt: カンマを追加しました。

sen.j: 北区と右京区の境界を成す衣笠山 (京都府)は、宇多天皇が夏のさなかに雪が見たいと所望して白絹をかけたという故事から「きぬかけ山」とも呼ばれた。
sen.e: Kinugasa-yama Mountain (Kyoto Prefecture), which constitutes the border between Kita Ward and Ukyo Ward, was named Kinukake-yama because, according to a traditional folklore, Emperor Uda wished to see snow even in summer and had the mountain covered with a white silk cloth..
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Kinugasa-yama Mountain (Kyoto Prefecture), which constitutes the border between Kita Ward and Ukyo Ward, was named Kinukake-yama because, according to a traditional folklore, Emperor Uda wished to see snow even in summer and had the mountain covered with a white silk cloth.

Mt. Kinugasa (Kyoto Prefecture), which constitutes the border between Kita Ward and Ukyo Ward, was named Kinukake-yama (literally, a mountain covered with a white silk cloth) because, according to a traditional folklore, Emperor Uda wished to see snow even in summer and had the mountain covered with a white silk cloth.
sen.cmt: きぬかけ山の意味を括弧で補足しました。

sen.j: それが衣笠山の南麓一帯であるこの地の地名の由来となっている。
sen.e: The area covering the southern foot of Kinugasa-yama Mountain is named so after this story.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The area covering the southern foot of Kinugasa-yama Mountain is named after this story.
The area covering the southern foot of Mt. Kinugasa is named after this story.

sen.j: 鹿苑寺、龍安寺、等持院などの名刹、京都府立堂本印象美術館や立命館大学衣笠キャンパスなどの文教施設も立地しており、四季を通じて多くの観光客で賑わう。
sen.e: It is crowded with many tourists throughout the year, because there are famous temples such as Rokuon-ji Temple, Ryoan-ji Temple, and Tojiin Temple, and education and cultural facilities such as Kyoto Prefectural Insho-Domoto Museum of Fine Art and Ritsumeikan University Kinugasa Campus.

It is crowded with many tourists throughout the year, because of famous temples such as Rokuon-ji Temple, Ryoan-ji Temple, and Tojiin Temple, as well as education and cultural facilities such as Kyoto Prefectural Insho-Domoto Museum of Fine Art and Ritsumeikan University Kinugasa Campus.

It is crowded with many tourists throughout the year, because of famous temples such as Rokuon-ji Temple, Ryoan-ji Temple, and Toji-in Temple, as well as education and cultural facilities such as Kyoto Prefectural Insho-Domoto Museum of Fine Art and Ritsumeikan University Kinugasa Campus.

sen.j: 地域内を走る鉄道は無く、路線バスのみ。
sen.e: No railway is in service within the area and only regular bus services are available.
No railway is in service within the area and only regular bus services are available.
No railway is in service within the area and only regular bus services are available.
